intro: Gonolobus calycosus, commonly known as the tropical milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are usually hairy, and it thrives in warm, sunny environments. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes other milkweeds known for their milky sap. Gonolobus calycosus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
